tie
to

of those of Flushing

fol.99r
Belgia 1591 stilo Ro
m
25 Fe
b
M
r
Bodly
Belgia: 1591
S
r
after my hartie Comendac
o
ns. The
Queenes Ma
tie
hearing by frequent report out of those low Countries the
misliking both of the
States,
and of the Common people, of the
Queenes Ma
t
determination to have w
th
drawen Certen of hir band
there, of hir auxiliarye Companies, is so trobled therew
th
,
t
although
she hath made a full resolution to have none drawen from thence
but
t
she will first send nombers to supplie the same, and of that
resolution she hath acquainted the deputies of
e States here, and
hath sent
S
r
John Norreys
w
th
the same resolution, who hath
bene at
Sandwiche
there stayd and not yett passed as I thinke
by reason of the North easte wynde: Hir Ma
tie
for hir better
satisfaction Conceyding that some passenge, maye w
th
a Northerly
wynde passe from
Harwiche,
and doubting the Contynuance of the
easterly wynde shall stay S
r
John Norreys, hath Commuanded me
w
th
all speede, to dyrect some l
re
s from Harwiche to yo
w
, w
ch
I do
at this p
nt
send thither if possible the wynde may suffer the
passage: And hereby I do require yo
w
to impart this resolution
of hir Ma
tie
not onlie to the States, and the
Counsell,
but otherwise
to be published, as yo
w
shall see Cause to the Governors of the
Townes, and
t
yo
w
do inhibite all Captaines, and Bandes to staye
from going to
e Sea side w
th
any intention to Come over, untill
S
r
John Norreys shalbe Come thither, and have accorded w
th
the States, for the number, of the Bandes and the manner, how
they shalbe removed, and untill the newe Bandes shalbe shipped
thither. And though the knowledg hereof may be brought unto
yo
w
before this l
re
shall Come unto yo
w
(for hereof I have written
by diverse unto yow) yett this is hir Ma
t
pleasure. I should use
the prevencion
t
I might w
ch
I nowe remytt to Wynde, and
Weather: Praying yo
w
to advertise me by how many meanes hereafter
fol.99v
Belgia: 1591: Feb
r
yo
w
shall have advertisement from me of this matter:
I do heare, that the deputies from the
Emperor
were not
arryved at
Brussells
x dayes paste, but
t
it was thought
they should mete w
th
the Duke of
Parma
at
e [Spawe]
for w
ch
purpose
Richardot
was sent thither to mete
em
Of the truthe Whereof I am sure yo
w
shall not be there
long ignorant.
And so Fare yow hartely well.
25 feb
r
1590
Your very lovyng frend William Burghley
